metadata.synopsis: After learning of the Crown of Karsus and the way it means potential ascension, Gale invites the players to share in his potential divinity. He brings them to an illusory part of the Outer planes, where they sail through the stars on a boat.

32.speaker: Gale
32.text: I owe you an apology. Things became quite heated between us before, after I learned of the Crown of Karsus. I allowed myself to get carried away, and failed to properly explain myself.

162.speaker: Gale
162.text: Thank you. But I owe you more than that. I need to help you understand just what this could mean for us.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Perhaps now is the time to explain then.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Apologies are useless if you're still intent on doing something dangerous.

94.speaker: Gale
94.text: When are we not doing something dangerous? Give me a chance - I think I can help you understand.

103.speaker: Gale
103.text: I can't. Your opinion matters greatly to me. Give me a chance - I think I can help you understand.

55.speaker: Gale
55.text: Ah. You're still talking to me then?

7.speaker: Gale
7.text: I wouldn't blame you for giving me a wide berth. I thought the orb's ever-present censure had tamed my wilder ambition, but that wasn't the case.

76.speaker: Gale
76.text: I needed Mystra's intervention. She offered me a path to redemption at last, and it might yet leave my mind and body intact.

1.speaker: Gale
1.text: Please - continue to believe in me. I want to show you the wizard I am capable of being, rather than the poor excuse for a man who's kept you company thus far.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I believe in you Gale. Always have, always will.

37.speaker: Gale
37.text: That's all I ever need to hear.

104.speaker: Gale
104.text: I know what I must do. The Crown belongs under Mystra's stewardship, not mine, and I will ensure she gets it.

71.speaker: Gale
71.text: That means there'll be no permanent place in the heavens for us. But we could still visit.

154.speaker: Gale
154.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player closes their eyes and the screen briefly fades to black. Gale speaks over black, casting a spell.NodeContext: Latin spellcasting - ass-tra navi-gah-mus ('we sail the stars')

49.speaker: Gale
49.text: Few mortals ever glimpse what you're about to see. But don't be alarmed - I'm here with you. Now... open your eyes.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Black screen. Gale speaks in VO

88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade up from black as the player opens their eyes to a dazzling spectacle. They and Gale are now sitting in a small boat that shimmers with iridescent light. Unpiloted, it silently meanders through a majestic, infinite starfield.

135.speaker: Gale
135.text: Quite the view, isn't it? The Outer Planes are a place of profound, sometimes overwhelming possibility.

167.speaker: Gale
167.text: I conjured this illusion often during my confinement in Waterdeep. An escape for the mind, where there was none for the body.

50.speaker: Gale
50.text: It was easier to stare at the celestial abyss than recognise the emptiness within myself. Easier to pretend my destiny lay among such stars, than work to salvage a life on solid ground. You changed all that.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Just what am I agreeing to?

119.speaker: Player
119.text: No, Gale. Whatever you have to show me - I don't need it.

150.speaker: Gale
150.text: No matter. Far be it for me to impose the majesty of the celestial canvas on those unwilling to partake of its beauty.
150.context: NodeContext: A bit miffed but trying to take it on the chin

62.speaker: Gale
62.text: Enjoy the rest of your evening.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: You're willing to give up the chance of unlimited power. I'd say your ambition is under control.

168.speaker: Gale
168.text: If that's true, it's thanks to you, and the trust you show in me at every turn of this strange adventure of ours.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: I hope so, because honestly you have been a poor man recently. Especially on the romance front...

123.speaker: Gale
123.text: I'm sorry. It's not easy living for more than just yourself, when for so long just staying alive was accomplishment enough.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: You're more to me than magic, Gale.

112.speaker: Gale
112.text: You stole the words from my mouth.

70.speaker: Gale
70.text: I don't think I deserve you at times. I told you of my ambitions - the likes of which many would baulk at - and yet you remain at my side.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: You're welcome - but don't put yourself down. You deserve me, and a lot more besides.

101.speaker: Gale
101.text: It gladdens me to hear you say that. Perhaps I can show my gratitude another way - by demonstrating exactly what ascension will mean to me. To us.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I'll stand by you. But some further explanation of what you intend wouldn't go amiss.

79.speaker: Gale
79.text: Words alone are not enough. Permit me to show you. Please, close your eyes a moment.

163.speaker: Gale
163.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player closes their eyes and the screen briefly fades to black. Gale speaks over black, casting a spell.NodeContext: Latin spellcasting - ass-tra navi-gah-mus ('we sail the stars')

83.speaker: Gale
83.text: Few mortals ever glimpse what you're about to see. But don't be alarmed - I'm here with you. Now... open your eyes.
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Black screen. Gale speaks in VO

22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade up from black as the player opens their eyes to a dazzling spectacle. They and Gale are now sitting in a small boat that shimmers with iridescent light. Unpiloted, it silently meanders through a majestic, infinite starfield.

165.speaker: Gale
165.text: The Outer Planes. This is where gods dwell. Where they observe us from afar. Where they make play-things of us.
165.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

23.speaker: Gale
23.text: They would keep all of this from us - the power, the possibilities. They only want us to serve them, pray to them... and ultimately, die for them.
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

108.speaker: Gale
108.text: But what if we didn't need them? What if we wielded their power instead, and helped ourselves in all the ways they refuse to. I could make that happen. I could make this illusion a reality, with you by my side.
108.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: You're still determined to do this, after all that was said?

107.speaker: Gale
107.text: How could I not crave this? But I don't want it for myself, alone - I want you at my side, willing and wholehearted.
107.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: You know how I feel. I've already voiced my support.

137.speaker: Gale
137.text: Yes, you have. But I want more than your support. I want your heart.
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: Are you saying you want to ascend? Claim godhood?

164.speaker: Gale
164.text: No, not like that. I don't want to join them, I want to better them. A god's powers, paired with a mortal conscience, a mortal heart.
164.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I don't need the stars, Gale. I have you.

133.speaker: Gale
133.text: Then have me - but have the best possible version of me.
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: You'd defy Mystra? As if we need more enemies.

93.speaker: Gale
93.text: I've already defied Mystra. Had I followed her command, there'd be nothing left of me but a smoking crater.
93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

60.speaker: Gale
60.text: The tadpoles, the orb - these threats to our existence - the gods could aid us if they wished, but instead they cower behind Ao. So let us act ourselves.
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.NodeContext: Ao = AY-oh (an overlord deity that most gods answer to)

114.speaker: Gale
114.text: With the power of the crown, any foe would be rendered impotent. Any obstacle would be dwarfed by our might.
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

35.speaker: Gale
35.text: I used to believe Mystra's forgiveness was worth dying for. But I was wrong. You showed me just how much I have to live for.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

128.speaker: Gale
128.text: With you, I forget my goddess. I love you.
128.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

41.speaker: Gale
41.text: Tell me you feel the same way. Tell me you want what I want. Please.
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I feel the same. Whatever you need of me, consider it done.

73.speaker: Gale
73.text: Right now, I need nothing more than a kiss. Then we'll face what is to come, together. And claim the crown when the time comes.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: You know I would if I could. But I'll sit with you as long as you'll have me.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Let's not grow complacent - that path you speak of is sure to be a dangerous one.

5.speaker: Gale
5.text: No doubt it will be - abominably so. As is just about everything we do. But I know we're up to the task. Are you still with me?
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Wait. Perhaps I'm being too hasty... and perhaps you're overreaching.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I love you. But for the man that you are. Not the god you'd pretend to be.

87.speaker: Gale
87.text: But think what I offer. The vastness of eternity to explore, the Weave at our fingertips... You would really prefer me as I am?
87.context: NodeContext: Genuine, vulnerable - the player just told him they loved him in a way that no one else has

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Stop his protests with a kiss.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Stop his protests with a kiss.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: You're right. We should not deny ourselves such a gift. The crown must be ours.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: I don't know what to say.

121.speaker: Gale
121.text: Say yes. But if words fail you, I'll accept a kiss.
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

110.speaker: Gale
110.text: No doubt it will be - abominably so. As is just about everything we do. But I know we're up to the task. What do you say...?
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: This is wrong, Gale. That power will corrupt you, even if you can seize it.

67.speaker: Gale
67.text: It won't, I swear to you. It's merely a tool - a means to an end.
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

33.speaker: Gale
33.text: You told me once to choose you, the one who loved me. That's what this is all about. Do you doubt me?
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale's expression wilts with disappointment. Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: If you believe this can be done, then I will believe too.

148.speaker: Gale
148.text: You mean... you want the same as I do?
148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.NodeContext: Hope rising again

158.speaker: Player
158.text: Yes. I want you to seize the crown, and make us a new world.

152.speaker: Gale
152.text: I've never wanted to kiss you more than I do now.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: Yes. I want you to seize the crown, and make us a new world.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Yes. I want you to seize the crown, and make us a new world.

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: Then it will be so. With you and I together, there's not a force in existence that can stop us.
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: I can't, Gale. This is best forgotten. I love you as you are.

69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale's shoulders sag. The starfield around seems to dim. Distant points of light vanish into the infinite dark.

122.speaker: Gale
122.text: What more is there to be said?
122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: Plenty, in time. This doesn't have to be the end for us - just forget the crown.

117.speaker: Gale
117.text: But I could be so much more to you.
117.context: CinematicNodeContext: Crestfallen expression. Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.NodeContext: crestfallen

96.speaker: Player
96.text: You're already everything I need you to be.

20.speaker: Gale
20.text: I hope you're right. I truly do. Godly power, perhaps I can live without, but you? You're everything.
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Expression brightening up. Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Gale are seated facing each other but do not lean in to kiss.

18.speaker: Gale
18.text: You put the stars to shame. Let's sit here another while - I want to drink you in.
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

75.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat drifts away amidst the stars. (No touching)

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: You see me as I am, and do not find me wanting. With these stars as my witness, I swear - you will always be enough for me.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

85.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player and Gale lean in to kiss while seated facing each other.

0.speaker: Gale
0.text: You put the stars to shame. Let's sit here another while - I want to drink you in.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

64.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat drifts away amidst the stars.

9.speaker: Gale
9.text: You see me as I am, and do not find me wanting. With these stars as my witness, I swear - you will always be enough for me.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Say nothing. Answer him with a kiss instead.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Say nothing. Answer him with a kiss instead.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: Enough. If you won't see sense, just take me back.

131.speaker: Gale
131.text: As you wish. Take a moment to soak the view. I doubt you will be privy to it again.
131.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.NodeContext: Resigned.

34.context: CinematicNodeContext: The remaining stars blink out like snuffed candles, leaving only the faint glow of the boat. Gale and the player sit silently for a moment. The scene fades fully to black.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: This folly is your own - I want nothing to do with it.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I don't doubt your motivations, but do this, and you will match Karsus' folly with your own.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: You plan to dethrone the gods themselves - it's lunacy.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Just what am I agreeing to?

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: A little boat voyage, that's all. Indulge me.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Coy smileNodeContext: A little cheeky/coy. Holding back a surprise he's arranged.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: No, Gale. I've indulged you enough.

78.speaker: Gale
78.text: I suppose if you see it that way... there's little else to be said, is there. Enjoy your evening.
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Crestfallen expressionNodeContext: Quietly devastated after the player rebuffs him.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I'm starting to regret our relationship. What am I even getting myself into?

29.speaker: Gale
29.text: Remain steadfast - there is nothing to fear from what awaits me. In fact... allow me to show you. Words alone are not enough.

82.speaker: Gale
82.text: Please, close your eyes a moment.

72.speaker: Gale
72.text: There you are. I was worried you might have second thoughts after my little confrontation with Mystra.

157.speaker: Gale
157.text: Most would think me foolish, deluded even, for daring to pursue dreams of wielding Karsus' Crown. I do not take your faith lightly.

80.speaker: Gale
80.text: Ah, you've a moment for me? I was hoping to speak to you - I confess, my thoughts have been somewhat scattered since my audience with Mystra.

13.speaker: Gale
13.text: The Karsite Weave could offer more than just power - it could bestow divinity. If I only trust myself to wield it.

127.speaker: Gale
127.text: I know this may not be the course you would choose for me, but before you protest - you should at least know what it is you would be advising against.

132.speaker: Gale
132.text: A pity I did not learn all she had to offer, but the fact that she summoned me to her presence is proof enough that the Crown of Karsus is worth pursuing.

84.speaker: Gale
84.text: I must admit, the Crown of Karsus has occupied my every thought since I learned of it. If I can seize it, and use it... the possibilities for both of us are infinite.

111.speaker: Gale
111.text: I must admit, the Crown of Karsus has occupied my every thought since we learned of it.

42.speaker: Gale
42.text: If we can seize it, and use it... the possibilities are endless. Yet you haven't uttered a peep one way or the other about it.

36.speaker: Gale
36.text: The power to change the world - it may be within our reach. You must have an opinion, surely.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I'm here to support you, no matter what you want.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: So much power will only prove dangerous. You should forget it.

52.speaker: Gale
52.text: But I cannot. You would  not be able to either, if you knew what I knew. Please, allow me to show you. Just close your eyes a moment.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: I don't know what to say. How can I respond to something so... immense? It's beyond comprehension.

134.speaker: Gale
134.text: Then the fault lies with me, and my inadequate words. Please, allow me to show you instead. Just close your eyes a moment.
